attributes.action: Stop the GCSE and A-level schedule being rearranged to accommodate Ramadan!
attributes.background: David Cameron said himself that the UK is a Christian country, why then are we rearranging  our GCSE and A-level schedule to suit the Muslim minority?    This is totally unacceptable as it is prejudice against other religions for which we do not make special accommodation.  STOP IT NOW!

rejection.details:
Decisions about the dates of exams are taken by exam boards, not by the UK Government or Parliament. 

You may be interested in this recent statement made by the Joint Council for Qualifications, which is a membership organisation comprising the seven largest providers of qualifications in the UK:

http://www.jcq.org.uk/media-centre/news-releases/jcq-statement---exam-timetables
